page.title: 05Stoke Pero Church
page.content: Stoke Pero Church is a small church 1013 feet above sea level on Exmoor. It has a Beautiful decorated timber roof but is otherwise quite plain. The tower has three bells and the organ was built in the U.S.A. The church was restored between 1820 and 1870. There are many evidences that the church has always had a very small congregation. Among 24 or so gravestones in the churchyard we counted only 9 different surnames. No Rector was appointed between 1675 and 1804 and the original dedication of the church is unknown. It is now dedicated to St. Peter because of his associations with a rock and sheep. The Rector of Porlock is in charge and a service is held once a month in this beautiful setting.
